alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Beaverhead and Western Madison below 6000ft; Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Canyon Ferry Area; Cascade County below 5000ft; East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Pondera and Eastern Teton; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains; Fergus County below 4500ft; Gallatin Valley; Gallatin and Madison County Mountains and Centennial Mountains; Gates of the Mountains; Helena Valley; Hill County; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Little Belt and Highwood Mountains; Madison River Valley; Meagher County Valleys; Missouri Headwaters; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains; Northwest Beaverhead County; Ruby Mountains and Southern Beaverhead Mountains; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Southern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front; Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 4:13AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Changing weather conditions expected today thru Tuesday... Dense fog will affect the Helena valley, with patchy fog possible elsewhere over Southwest MT before 11 AM this morning. It turns windy this afternoon, with wind gusts over 50 mph likely along the front range of the Rockies and adjacent Plains. For tonight, a cold front will move southward through North Central MT. The cold front will arrive near the U.S. Canadian border around 11 PM tonight, it be near Great Falls around 2 AM Tuesday and it will be near Helena around 4 AM Tuesday. The cold front will continue to move southward through the remainder of Southwest MT on Tuesday morning. Gusty north winds will accompany the frontal passage, along with scattered rain and snow showers. Most of the snow will fall at elevations above 6000 feet, but some snow could mix in at times at lower elevations. Snow accumulations generally around an inch or so are possible at higher elevations. Anyone who has travel plans or plans to be outside today through Tuesday morning over North Central or Southwest MT should be prepared for quickly changing weather conditions.
